title: Coronavirus: This is what reopening in US looks like
description: Barber shops, tattoo parlours, beaches and restaurants reopen in Georgia.

title: 'I wanted doors I could slam': Growing up in a see-through house
description: Shelley Klein lived in a modernist masterpiece - but envied her friends' more traditional homes.

title: Coronavirus: Transgender people 'extremely vulnerable' during lockdown
description: Rights groups say coronavirus restrictions are leaving vulnerable trans people even more exposed.

title: The Valentine's Day snake puzzle
description: Why were 29 snakes left in pillowcases in a Sunderland dustbin the day before and the day after Valentine's Day?

title: Coronavirus: Wild animals enjoy freedom of a quieter world
description: Lockdowns give parts of the natural world an opportunity to experience life with fewer humans around.

title: The trees that survived the bombing of Hiroshima
description: How a message of hope and peace is being spread by trees

title: Refugee camp image wins food photo contest
description: An image of children at a Rohingya refugee camp wins Pink Lady Food Photographer of the Year 2020.

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown on a deserted Australian Island
description: How one Australian couple ended up isolated in paradise on Fraser Island.

title: Coronavirus: Two million Bangladesh jobs 'at risk' as clothes orders dry up
description: Half of the four million garment industry jobs in Bangladesh could be lost as orders dry up.

title: Coronavirus: 'My cafe's going bust before it's even opened'
description: A car factory worker turned cafe owner explains how coronavirus is affecting his business dream.

title: India coronavirus: The man giving dignified burial to Covid-19 victims
description: Abdul Malabari has taken on the task of burying those who died with the virus in one Indian city.

title: Coronavirus: 98-year-old doctor working through the lockdown
description: France's oldest doctor continues to support patients, despite being at high risk of getting coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Scottish government suggests covering face in shops
description: Scottish government recommends wearing face coverings in some social settings

title: Coronavirus: NHS doctor's son asks Matt Hancock for public apology
description: Intisar Chowdhury calls on the health secretary to admit mistakes were made in supplying protective kit.

title: Coronavirus: Lack of sign language interpreters leads to legal case against government
description: The lack of sign language interpreters at the UK government's daily coronavirus press briefings has morphed from Twitter campaign to legal proceedings.

title: Coronavirus: Government pledges £3.1m for children abused in lockdown
description: MPs will debate domestic abuse later amid evidence it is on the rise during the coronavirus crisis.

title: Coronavirus: Care home deaths up as hospital cases fall
description: Outbreaks in care homes claiming 2,000 lives a week, but hospital fatalities are going down.

title: Uefa wants leagues to decide by 25 May whether they will complete season
description: European leagues are asked to tell Uefa by 25 May whether they want to complete or cancel their seasons.

title: UKA's Salazar review head Rowell to leave board a year earlier than planned
description: Sarah Rowell, who led UK Athletics' 2015 internal review into its handling of the Alberto Salazar scandal, is to step down a year before planned.

title: Coronavirus risk: 'I call it shop-worker roulette'
description: The Resolution Foundation says women and young people are most likely to bear the brunt of Covid-19.

title: Tokyo Olympics 'will not be postponed again'
description: The postponed Tokyo Olympics will be "scrapped" if they cannot take place in 2021, says Games chief Yoshiro Mori.

title: Millions fall silent for key workers
description: The UK joined together to commemorate the front-line workers who have died with coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: HSBC puts 35,000 job cuts on hold
description: The bank says it will pause the cuts to avoid leaving staff unable to find work elsewhere.

title: Smethwick shopping centre murder police arrest eight
description: Four men are held on suspicion of murder over the knifing at Smethwick's West Cross Shopping Centre.

title: Coronavirus: Property sales worth £82bn 'on hold amid lockdown
description: Some 373,000 property sales are on hold in the UK owing to the coronavirus lockdown, analysis suggests.

title: Spanish stars lead tributes after ex-Liverpool striker & broadcaster Robinson dies at 61
description: Former Liverpool and Republic of Ireland striker Michael Robinson dies at the age of 61.

title: Coronavirus: The weekly shop is back in fashion, says Tesco boss
description: Supermarket boss Dave Lewis says shopping trips are less frequent but basket sizes have doubled.

title: Coronavirus: Trump 'can't imagine why' US disinfectant calls spiked
description: The president says he takes no responsibility for a reported spike in calls to emergency hotlines.

title: #GoalsAtHome: Can you recreate this Juan Mata scissor-kick?
description: For this week's #GoalsAtHome challenge, we want you to stay at home and recreate this stunning scissor-kick from Juan Mata for Manchester United against Liverpool.

title: The Papers: 'Hope in sight' as UK nears 'second phase of battle'
description: Boris Johnson's strategy for how the UK will exit the lockdown dominates Tuesday's front pages.

title: Coronavirus: What Trump voters think of his handling of crisis
description: "Dumbfounded" or "great job" - Americans who backed the president in 2016 rate his pandemic response.
